alternative_parents.description: Inorganic salt compounds containing a chlorine atom either in its ionic form or bonded to another atom (metal or halogen).
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic chloride salts

class.description: Inorganic salt compounds in which the heaviest ionic metal atom is an alkali metal.
class.name: Alkali metal salts

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as alkali metal chlorides. These are inorganic compounds in which the largest halogen atom is Chlorine, and the heaviest metal atom is an alkali metal.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds in which the largest halogen atom is Chlorine, and the heaviest metal atom is an alkali metal.
direct_parent.name: Alkali metal chlorides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds in which the largest halogen atom is Chlorine, and the heaviest metal atom is an alkali metal.
subclass.name: Alkali metal chlorides

superclass.description: Compounds that contains both metal and non metal atoms.
superclass.name: Mixed metal/non-metal compounds
